result.execSummary:
The defendant William Craigen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
**Pay DNA surcharge.
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  Perform 100 hrs of community service work for a public agency or a non profit charitable organization.  May Not have contact with Heather or Mark I or their residence unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No contact with known felons, maintain sobriety.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber allowed.  Credit for 111 days. Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

4 yrs WSP; 2 yrs Initial followed by 2 yrs ES.  Eligible for CIP & SAP

State appears by Special Prosecutor Thaddeus McGuire.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  DE is sentenced to 4 years in the WSP forthwith with credit for 409 days.  2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  DE is ordered to complete 100 hours of community service.  He is also ordered to pay all costs including restitution as previously ordered during extended supervision.  No contact with Heather or Mark I. unless permitted by the court or agent.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michael Barth.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and statement given by victim in court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 5 years with conditions.  See conditions.  As a condition court imposes 9 months in the KCJ forthwith with credit for 111 days.  Huber & Work Crew privileges authorized.  Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $2352.96.   DE ordered to complete 100 hrs community service and shall have no contact with victims unless permitted by the court only.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
